tier.item: (2) Icelandic
Það var oft sem mér fannst ég eoft vera utanvelta.
It was often R E L . P RT me thought I be outsider
`It was often that I felt as I was being an outsider.'
(2) Icelandic
Það var oft sem mér fannst ég eoft vera utanvelta.
It was often R E L . P RT me thought I be outsider
`It was often that I felt as I was being an outsider.'
(2) Icelandic
Það var oft sem mér fannst ég eoft vera utanvelta.
It was often R E L.P RT me thought I be outsider
It was often that I felt as I was being an outsider.
(3) Faroese
Tað var eg sum eeg tók húgvina hjá tær.
It was I R E L . P RT took cap.the at you
`It was me that took your cap.'
(3) Faroese
Tað var eg sum eeg tók húgvina hjá tær.
It was I R E L . P RT took cap.the at you
`It was me that took your cap.'

Tað var eg sum eeg tók húgvina hjá tær.
It was I R E L.P RT took cap.the at you
It was me that took your cap.
(4) Da n i s h
Det er rødt, som erødt henviser til rodcenteret.
It is red R E L . P RT refers to root.center.the
`It is red that refers to the root center.'

Det er rødt, som erødt henviser til rodcenteret.
It is red R E L . P RT refers to root.center.the
`It is red that refers to the root center.'

Det er rødt, som erødt henviser til rodcenteret.
It is red R E L.P RT refers to root.center.the
It is red that refers to the root center.
(5) Norwegian
Det er i januar at man gjør de beste kjøpene ei .
januar
It is in January that one does the best buy.the
`It is in January that one does the best buying.'
(5) Norwegian
Det er i januar at man gjør de beste kjøpene ei januar .
It is in January that one does the best buy.the
`It is in January that one does the best buying.'
(5) Norwegian
Det er i januar at man gjør de beste kjøpene ei januar .
It is in January that one does the best buy.the
It is in January that one does the best buying.
(6) Swedish
Jag har alltid vetat att det är skriva som jag vill göra .
skriva
I have always known that it is write R E L . P RT I want do
`I have always known that what I wanted to do was write.'
(6) Swedish
Jag har alltid vetat att det är skriva som jag vill göra skriva .
I have always known that it is write R E L . P RT I want do
`I have always known that what I wanted to do was write.'
(6) Swedish
Jag har alltid vetat att det är skriva som jag vill göra skriva .
I have always known that it is write R E L.P RT I want do
I have always known that what I wanted to do was write.
(7) Swedish: Subject- and object clefts possible
a. Det var Jon som tappade nycklarna.
It was Jon R E L . P RT lost keys.the
`It was Jon who lost the keys.'
(7) Swedish: Subject- and object clefts possible
a. Det var Jon som tappade nycklarna.
It was Jon R E L . P RT lost keys.the
`It was Jon who lost the keys.'
(7) Swedish: Subject- and object clefts possible
Det var Jon som tappade nycklarna.
It was Jon R E L.P RT lost keys.the
It was Jon who lost the keys.
b. Det var nycklarna som Jon tappade.
It was keys.the R E L . P RT Jon lost
`It were the keys that Jon lost.'
b. Det var nycklarna som Jon tappade.
It was keys.the R E L . P RT Jon lost
`It were the keys that Jon lost.'
Det var nycklarna som Jon tappade.
It was keys.the R E L.P RT Jon lost
It were the keys that Jon lost.
(8) Icelandic: Acceptability of object clefts varies
a. Það var Jón sem t ýndi l ykl unum .
It was Jón R E L . P RT lost keys.the
`It was Jón who lost the keys.'
(8) Icelandic: Acceptability of object clefts varies
a. Það var Jón sem t ýndi l ykl unum .
It was Jón R E L . P RT lost keys.the
`It was Jón who lost the keys.'
(8) Icelandic: Acceptability of object clefts varies
Það var Jón sem t ýndi l ykl unum .
It was Jón R E L.P RT lost keys.the
It was Jón who lost the keys.
b. %Það voru lyklarnir sem J ón t ýndi .
It was keys.the R E L . P RT Jón lost
`It was the keys that Jón lost.'
b. %Það voru lyklarnir sem J ón t ýndi .
It was keys.the R E L . P RT Jón lost
`It was the keys that Jón lost.'
%Það voru lyklarnir sem J ón t ýndi .
It was keys.the R E L.P RT Jón lost
It was the keys that Jón lost.
(9) Swedish: Binding of reflexive possessives possible
Det var sinai / *hansi nycklar som Joni tappade.
It was R E FL . P O S S / his keys R E L . P RT Jon lost
`It were his keys that Jon lost.'
(9) Swedish: Binding of reflexive possessives possible
Det var sinai / *hansi nycklar som Joni tappade.
It was R E FL . P O S S / his keys R E L . P RT Jon lost
`It were his keys that Jon lost.'
(9) Swedish: Binding of reflexive possessives possible
Det var sinai / *hansi nycklar som Joni tappade.
It was R E FL.P O S S / his keys R E L.P RT Jon lost
It were his keys that Jon lost.
(10) Icelandic: Acceptability of binding varies
Það var út af svölunum %s í n u m i / *hennari sem mammai datt.
It was out of balconies.the R E FL . P O S S / her REL. mother fell
P RT
`It was from her balconies that mother fell.'
(10) Icelandic: Acceptability of binding varies
Það var út af svölunum %s í n u m i / *hennari sem mammai datt.
It was out of balconies.the R E FL . P O S S / her REL. P RT mother fell
`It was from her balconies that mother fell.'
(10) Icelandic: Acceptability of binding varies
Það var út af svölunum %s í n u m i / *hennari sem mammai datt.
It was out of balconies.the R E FL.P O S S / her REL.P RT mother fell
It was from her balconies that mother fell.
(11) Icelandic: S E M always obligatory
a. Var það af því að það var hann *(sem) kyssti hana?
Was it because it was he R E L . P RT kissed her

a. Var það af því að það var hann *(sem) kyssti hana?

b. Var það af því að það var hann *(sem) hún kyssti?

`Did it happen because it was he that she kissed?'

(12) Norwegian: S O M obligatory in subject cleft s; optional in object clefts
a. Var det fordi det var han *(som) kyssa ho?
Was it because it was he R E L . P RT kissed her

a. Var det fordi det var han *(som) kyssa ho?
Was it because it was he R E L . P RT kissed her

Var det fordi det var han *(som) kyssa ho?
Was it because it was he R E L.P RT kissed her
b. Var det fordi det var han (som) ho kyssa?
Was it because it was he R E L . P RT she kissed
`Did it happen because it was he that s he kissed?'
b. Var det fordi det var han (som) ho kyssa?
Was it because it was he R E L . P RT she kissed
`Did it happen because it was he that s he kissed?'
Var det fordi det var han (som) ho kyssa?
Was it because it was he R E L.P RT she kissed
Did it happen because it was he that s he kissed?
(13) Icelandic: A Ð and S E M used "interchangeably"
Það var á laugardaginn sem / að við fórum í sumarbústaðinn.
It was on Saturday.the R E L . PA RT / that we went in summer.cottage.the
`It was on Saturday that we went to the cottage.'
(13) Icelandic: A Ð and S E M used "interchangeably"
Það var á laugardaginn sem / að við fórum í sumarbústaðinn.
It was on Saturday.the R E L . PA RT / that we went in summer.cottage.the
`It was on Saturday that we went to the cottage.'

Það var á laugardaginn sem / að við fórum í sumarbústaðinn.
It was on Saturday.the R E L.PA RT / that we went in summer.cottage.the
It was on Saturday that we went to the cottage.
(14) Swedish: Only S O M
Det var på lördag som / *att vi åkte till stugan.
It was on Saturday R E L . PA RT / that we went to cottage.the
`It was on Saturday that we went to the cottage.'

Det var på lördag som / *att vi åkte till stugan.
It was on Saturday R E L . PA RT / that we went to cottage.the

It was on Saturday R E L.PA RT / that we went to cottage.the
It was on Saturday that we went to the cottage.
(15) Danish: Only AT
Det var i lørdags *som / at vi tog ud til sommerhuset.
It was in Saturday R E L . PA RT / that we went out to summer.house.the
`It was on Saturday that we went to the cottage.'
(15) Danish: Only AT
Det var i lørdags *som / at vi tog ud til sommerhuset.
It was in Saturday R E L . PA RT / that we went out to summer.house.the
`It was on Saturday that we went to the cottage.'

Det var i lørdags *som / at vi tog ud til sommerhuset.
It was in Saturday R E L.PA RT / that we went out to summer.house.the

(16) Swedish: AT T combines with S O M
Det är av samma anledning som (att) han inte springer runt i stan.
It is of same reason R E L . P RT that he not runs around in town
`It is for the same reason that he doesn't run around in town.'

(17) Norwegian: Acceptability of S O M AT varies
%Det er ikkje så enkelt som at ein berre kan bytte språk.
It is not so simple R E L . P RT that one just can change language
`It isn't that simple that you can just change languages.'

(18) Danish: S O M ( AT ) combines with explet ive D E R (as in relative clauses)
Jeg tror bare at det er dig som (at) der er godt og grundigt stiv.
I believe just that it is you R E L . P RT that E X P L is good and thoroughly stiff
`I just believe that it is you that is being extraordinary stiff.'

h o me

(27) Icelandic: Lack of person agreement
a. Það varst / %var þú sem m i nnt i s t á þetta á fundinum.
It was.2 . S G / was.3 . S G you R E L . P RT mentioned.2 . S G on this on meeting.the
`It was you that mentioned this at the meeting.'
(27) Icelandic: Lack of person agreement
a. Það varst / %var þú sem m i nnt i s t á þetta á fundinum.
It was.2 . S G / was.3 . S G you R E L . P RT mentioned.2 . S G on this on meeting.the
`It was you that mentioned this at the meeting.'
(27) Icelandic: Lack of person agreement
Það varst / %var þú sem m i nnt i s t á þetta á fundinum.
It was.2.S G / was.3.S G you R E L.P RT mentioned.2.S G on this on meeting.the
It was you that mentioned this at the meeting.
b. Það voruð / %voru þið sem voruð með móral.
It was.2 . P L / were.3 . P L you R E L . P RT were.2 . P L with bad.atmosphere
`It was you that had bad atmosphere.'
b. Það voruð / %voru þið sem voruð með móral.

c. Það voruð / %voru þið sem hélduð / %héldu þessari síðu uppi.
It were.2 . P L / were.3 . P L you R E L . P RT kept.2 . / kept.3 . P L this page up
PL
`It was you that maintained this page.'

It were.2.P L / were.3.P L you R E L.P RT kept.2.PL / kept.3.P L this page up

(28) Icelandic: Lack of number agreement

PL
`It were they that were being kind of amusing.'

tier.item: (33) Icelandic: Preservation of lexical case
a. En það var honum sem völvan sagði ehonum allt það sem
But it was him.DAT R E L . P RT seeress.the told everything it R E L . P RT
stendur í Völuspá.
stands in The Seeress' Prophecy
`But she was the one to tell him everything that is told in The Seeress' Prophecy.'

(35) Norwegian: Nominative in a truncated cleft
Q Hvem som har drukket ginen? A Det var *meg / jeg.

CC M
`Who drank the gin?' `It was I.'

(37) Icelandic: Oblique subjects excluded from truncated clefts

AT AT
